blog.name: capbucky23
blog.title: Marvel💙
blog.description: Just another Marvel fan

summary:
So, this is just me introducing myself.
1. I'm from Serbia, so English isn't my first language, but I hope it still works
2. I'm...
body:
HELLO 👋

So, this is just me introducing myself.

1. I’m from Serbia, so English isn’t my first language, but I hope it still works

2. I’m 15 (16 in November)

3. Literally OBSESSED with Marvel characters, mostly Cap, Bucky, Loki, Thor, Spidey and Tony. ALSO X MEN💙

4. FUN FACT: I have around 1k pictures in my gallery right now, and 99% of them is smth about Marvel 😊

5. Also, I LOVE to read, and I’m HUGE music lover.

6. I love watching movies and series, for example: Ofc all mcu movies, hp, some DC movies, teen wolf, Grey’s anatomy, got and more.

7.I have been reading marvel fanfic for 2 months now, and I’d say I’m well prepared for this, Ofc if it works

8.So, yeah, this SHOULD be fanfiction account

Mega-Masterlist

title: Year of the Tiger Headcanon...
body:
Tiger hates Tony Stark for his stance in favor of the Sokovia Accord, which included a registration for mutants such as herself. Upon first meet Tiger lunged and had to be held back by Thor…When asked why Loki did not intercede he merely shrugged and stated “Tiger was in no real harm, why would I?”

((Year of the Tiger))

tags: source: idk my friend suggested this
summary:
Steve: Do you’ve got any tattoos?
Tony: Yeah on my arm ‘Rhodey and Tony forever’.
Natasha: But I thought Pepper is your...
body:
Steve: Do you’ve got any tattoos?
Tony: Yeah on my arm ‘Rhodey and Tony forever’.
Natasha: But I thought Pepper is your wife?
Tony: Yeah, she wasn't too happy about that.

tags: i had an idea and this happened
summary: Peter Parker, swinging into Stark Tower: Hey Jarvis  JARVIS: Yes, Mr Parker?  Peter, snickering: Does Tony Stark is gay? ...
body:
Peter Parker, swinging into Stark Tower: Hey Jarvis

JARVIS: Yes, Mr Parker?

Peter, snickering: Does Tony Stark is gay?

JARVIS: Tony Stark is gay is the most discussed in the media in the few years ago. Even it has happened in 2008, but some of the public still curious about what is exactly happening and to be the reason there is a rumor comes out about his gay. At that time he became the massive social networking rumor. The public, especially his fans are shocked. He just came out with his bad rumor which is spread massively. This time is not about his philanthropist career, but his bad rumor. The rumor is out of standardize of hoax, according the last reported this playboy revealed himself as homosexual. Do you still believe or not, this rumor is really much talked by people even in a person of his fans.

Peter: omg

tags: stark men are made of iron
summary:
Stark Men Are Made Of Iron - a MCU
  Tony Stark playlist (x) i. I Don’t Care by Fall Out Boy    I
    don’t care what you think
...
caption:
Stark Men Are Made Of Iron - a MCU Tony Stark playlist (x)

 i. I Don’t Care by Fall Out Boy

   I don’t care what you think

   as long as it’s about me

   the best of us can find happiness in misery

ii. Know Your Enemy by Green Day

   Do you know the enemy?

   Do you know your enemy?

   Well, gotta know the enemy

iii. Iron Man by Black Sabbath

   Nobody wants him

   They just turn their heads

   Nobody helps him

iv. How to Disappear Completely by Radiohead

   I’m not here

   In a little while

   I’ll be gone

v. Human by Rag'n'Bone Man

   I’m only human after all

   I’m only human after all

   Don’t put the blame on me

vi. Doubt by Twenty One Pilots

   Fear might be the death of me

   Fear leads to anxiety

   Don’t know what’s inside of me

vii. Restless Heart Syndrome by Green Day

  You’re a victim of your symptom

  You are your own worst enemy

  Know your enemy

viii. True Friends by Bring me the Horizon

  I’ll forget, but I’ll never forgive you

  Don’t you know, don’t you know

  True friends stab you in the front

ix. Everybody Knows by Sigrid

  Everybody knows it’s coming apart

  Take one last look at this sacred heart

  Before it blows

x. One by Metallica

  Now, the world is gone, I’m just one

  Oh, god, help me

  Hold my breath as I wish for death

summary: Gary Needs Tony (and Tony Needs Pepper)
title: Gary Needs Tony (and Tony Needs Pepper)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Pk9K6Y

by officialzeloswilder

Easy like Sunday morning, he said, “Gary is coming.”
“Excuse me?” Pepper walked closer, peered over his shoulder to see if the tablet in front of him had anything on it. The screen was black. “Gary?”

Tony forgets to send Gary a cancellation notice for the wedding. Pepper saves the day, again, and she saves Tony too.

Words: 2755, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Iron Man (Movies)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Pepper Potts, Gary (Iron Man movies)
  • Relationships: Pepper Potts/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Post-Avengers: Infinity War Part 1 (Movie), I have a lot of feelings


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Pk9K6Y

summary: Peter meets his gaze, then looks down.  “You could have told me,” Tony says gently, “I get it.” Peter shivers under the spray,...
question: Peter meets his gaze, then looks down.  “You could have told me,” Tony says gently, “I get it.” Peter shivers under the spray, and Tony opens a cabinet to pull out a big fluffy towel. Peter turns off the shower and steps into Tony’s outstretched arms. Tony wraps the towel around him and rubs briskly at his shoulders. “I was scared,” Peter admits, and Tony can’t respond- he kisses Peter instead. Peter melts against Tony, pressing hard into the kiss, and Tony regrets not knowing sooner.
answer: HEY, LISTEN HERE BUD, YOU REALLY OUT HERE DELIVERING MY TRANS PETER AND IM SO GRATEFUL. THANK YOU DEAR ANON.

summary: Tony finds out when Peter spills a corrosive chemical on himself in the lab. In seconds, Peter is stripping out of his T-shirt...
question: Tony finds out when Peter spills a corrosive chemical on himself in the lab. In seconds, Peter is stripping out of his T-shirt and racing to the safety shower while Tony has one of his bots collect the soaked T-shirt. Peter is not-quite-shirtless under the spray, and suddenly everything clicks into place- the little quirks Peter has, the way he falls back after flirting (it could only be flirting) with Tony. Tony understands; he watches the water bead across the tan fabric of Peter’s binder

body:
wrote the first chapter of my new bucky x tony fic called “To Watch A Watchman”, give it a read if thats your deal :D

Summary: Over the span of seventy years, Bucky had met many willing to die out of guilt. He was now for the first time in his life, looking at a man living out of it.

title: Video Games and Phoenix Metaphors
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2N1jMID

by wakandan_wardog

Pepper plays Pokemon GO for SI Employee Morale… But she thinks the boss should be in on it too, and the best way to get Tony to do something is to get Rhodey to do something, and then clue Tony in. (Hint: It works.)

Words: 1232, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Iron Man (Movies)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen, Multi
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Pepper Potts, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Jarvis (Iron Man movies)
  • Relationships: James “Rhodey” Rhodes & Tony Stark, Pepper Potts & Tony Stark, James “Rhodey” Rhodes & Pepper Potts
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Fusion, Crossovers & Fandom Fusions, Characters Playing Pokemon GO, Pokemon GO - Freeform, Friendship, Banter, Companionable Snark, Minor Character(s)


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2N1jMID

reblog.comment:

by wakandan_wardog

summary: Gary Needs Tony (and Tony Needs Pepper) - officialzeloswilder - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
title: Gary Needs Tony (and Tony Needs Pepper) - officialzeloswilder - Marvel Cinematic Universe [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Easy like Sunday morning, he said, “Gary is coming.”

“Excuse me?” Pepper walked closer, peered over his shoulder to see if the tablet in front of him had anything on it. The screen was black. “Gary?”

Tony forgets to send Gary a cancellation notice for the wedding. Pepper saves the day, again, and she saves Tony too.

title: Driving him crazy
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2L5YcBg

by Charionix

Peter is in desperate need of everyone to just leave him alone.

Honestly as cool as living in a compound full of superhumans and trained killers is, it sets a guy on edge. He’s never truly alone, and paranoia is sending him crazy.

Or … The one where Peter had moved in with the avengers and is in desperate need of a wank.

Words: 2073, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: M/M, Multi, Other
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Steve Rogers, Tony Stark, Friday (Marvel)
  • Additional Tags: Porn Watching, Masturbation, Caught, Peter-centric, BDSM, Kinky, Bisexuality, Mutants, Tumblr, Awkward Boners

summary: Broken Phones and A Million Worries
body:
Broken Phones and A Million Worries

◸

Author: @theironangel | ♚

Masterlist | ♛

Posted On/At: 7/18/2018 at 8:05 Central US Time Zone | ♜

Word Count: 1550 | ♝

Warnings: Other than that I’m a beginner writer so this may not be very in character, nothing really. Please enjoy. | ♞

◺

-

“Pete?” Tony sent the message to Peter’s phone after Peter had missed four phone calls from Tony, and another two from Happy.

“Kid, answer your phone.” Tony tried again, after a few minutes of no reply.

“Peter where are you?” Happy’s fingers tapped quickly at the screen when he tried texting Peter as well.

“He’s not answering me,” Happy said after a few minutes.

“Me neither. FRIDAY, pull up the location of Peter’s suit.” Tony answered Happy, then addressed the AI in the compound.

“Sure thing boss.” the AI responded. A holographic screen came up, showing the pair a map pinpointing where the Spider-Man suit was.

“Are you sure we should go get him? He’s probably busy fighting crime,” Happy raised an eyebrow, not looking up from his phone.

“First of all, I need help on this mission, and I haven’t seen Peter in forever. Secondly, if he was just busy fighting crime, he would have at least had KAREN send us a “Sorry can’t talk right now.” message. Third, doesn’t he live in Queens? Why would he be so far on a school night? His tracker says he’s in Staten Island,” Tony enlarged the map so Happy could see it better.

“You saw the kid last week,” Happy pointed out, “Anyway, Staten Island isn’t too far from Queens, Tony. Don’t jump to conclusions. Why don’t you get Rhodey to come on the mission with you?” Happy glanced up at Tony and the screen, switching his phone for the tablet on the table in front of him.

“A) Rhodey’s already coming, B) this was supposed to be Peter’s first mission as part of a team, and C) The last time Peter was in Staten Island with the suit, he got the ferry split in two.” Tony listed, counting the reasons with his fingers.

Happy rolled his eyes, looking back to his tablet. “At least try calling his suit directly through KAREN, before going find him.”

Tony nodded to Happy before walking to his lab, opening the door, and sitting down at his desk.

“Friday, can you call KAREN?”

“You want me to call KAREN?” FRIDAY asked.

“Yes, call KAREN. And don’t let Peter decline the call,” he added, pulling up the screen with the map showing the suit’s location, which hadn’t moved from Staten Island.

“Mr. Stark is that you?” Peter’s voice was raspy and Tony could hear the cough through the microphone in the suit.

“Yeah Peter it’s me. What are you doing? Happy and I’ve been texting and calling you, but you never responded. I’m a bit worried,”

“I’m uh, cold. Very cold. Like I can barely move cold. Uh I found-”

“Do you have the heater on?” Tony interrupted to ask.

“I think the heater is broken. KAREN says she can’t turn it on,” Peter coughed again.

“Are you okay? Do I need to come pick you up?”

“Actually that sounds good.” Peter said, “Why were you and Happy calling?”

“I was gonna take you on a mission with Rhodey, but you don’t really sound up for it,”

“Mr. Stark I am too up for it! I can-” Peter broke off in a fit of coughing and Tony’s eyebrows creased together in concern.

“You okay, Pete? Just stay where you are I’m on my way.”

“Don’t hang up on me please,”

“Course not bud. FRIDAY, reroute call to my phone.” Tony picked up his phone as FRIDAY switched the call from the home speaker to his phone.

“So what were you doing that made you so cold?” Tony asked, already walking to the garage.

“Uh well these two guys were trying to rob this girl, but obviously I stopped them. And the girl was thankful, and she let me walk her home, and so when we got to her apartment place she walked inside and was like thank you so much! So anyway I started walking home because it’s getting late and I’m tired. But as I was swinging home, someone or something cut the web that I was swinging on, and so I took an unplanned swim in the river, and apparently my heater’s broken, and I’m really cold and soaking wet,” Peter rambled, only cutting himself off a few times to cough loudly before continuing his story.

“Ok. How do you know the web was cut and it didn’t break?” When Peter finished his story, Tony was already in the car driving towards Peter.

“Well when I saw the broken end, it was way too even to have been a break. Like the web would’ve stretched if it broke, but this was a really clean cut, nothing stretched or anything. Also, for the web to break there would’ve had to have been a lot of pressure of the web, like way heavier than just me,” Peter thought back to how the only times he remembered his webs ever breaking was when he tried to catch the elevator and when he was trying to stop the ferry from sinking.

“Yeah, you did a great job making those things.” Tony complemented.

“Thanks! Hey Mr. Stark where are you anyway?”

“I’m very close to where you are now, just hang tight.” Tony rounded a corner in the car.

-

Tony pulled his car over near the bench Peter was sitting on and rolled down the window.

“Come on Spider-Man, get in the car.”

“Hey, Mr. Stark, thanks for coming!”

“No problem kid.” Tony reached over and turned up the heater as Peter climbed into the car.

“I found a really cute lost golden retriever puppy and helped him get back to his owner.”

“Cool, hey why didn’t you call or text Happy and I back?” Tony asked, turning the car around to get back to the compound.

“Uh…”

“Do you know where it is or can I buy you a new one?”

“Mr. Stark you don’t need to buy me a new phone. Probably.” Peter shivered in the car despite the heater being on full blast, and coughed again.

“So why weren’t you answering-”

“Mr. Stark, look out!” Peter yelled, spider senses going crazy as his eyes widened when they saw the large black van coming too fast at their car.

-

The lights were blinding when Peter could finally open his eyes to see where he was.

“Where?” He rasped out, voice still sore from the cold he probably had.

“You’re fine. You’re at the Avengers compound.” A voice that Peter didn’t recognize informed him.

“Mr. Stark?”

“No kid, it’s Rhodey. Tony’s in another room. Quite the accident y’all got into.” Rhodey was sitting near Peter’s feet at the end of the bed.

“Wasn’t our fault,” Peter responded sleepily, “Mr. Stark okay? May know?”

“Your Aunt May is on her way. Tony’s in another room.” Rhodey informed him.

“You already said that. Is Mr. Stark okay?” Peter sat up and looked Rhodey in the eye, ignoring the pain flaring through his left arm. “Is he?”

“Peter, please don’t hurt yourself anymore than you already are,”

“Tell me if Mr. Stark is okay or not!” Peter rarely yelled at people, but he was very worried about his mentor because he still hadn’t seen him yet.

“He’s fine Peter, nothing to worry about.”

“Is he awake?”

“Not yet,”

“Why not?”

“Peter, you just got into a pretty bad car accident. It was only three hours ago. Give him time.” Rhodey stood up from his position at the feet of Peter’s bed.

“Do you need anything to eat? Drink?” Rhodey asked.

“Water please.” Peter sighed and laid back into the pillows on his bed, grateful that his throat wasn’t sore and his cough seemed to have gone away.

-

“Mr. Stark!” Peter yelled, popping up from the couch he was sitting on to look at his mentor leaning against the doorway to the living room.

“So why weren’t you answering your phone?” Tony continued the conversation as if nothing had happened, as if three days hadn’t passed since the car accident.

“My phone kinda exploded?” Peter adjusted the sling on his arm, careful not to hurt himself.

“It, the, what?”

“Well there was a fire, and I helped get the people out and I went back in to make sure everyone was out safely but the building started groaning, and I swung out really quickly but I dropped my phone, and I couldn’t go back because the building pretty much exploded.” Peter explained leaning back into the couch.

“So you weren’t getting the messages or call through KAREN until I called her directly?” Tony pushed off the doorway he was leaning on and sat on a chair across from the couch.

“Nope.” He replied popping the P. “I had no idea you guys were calling or texting me, and KAREN didn’t tell me about it.”

“I wonder if that has anything to do with the broken heater?” Tony shifted in his seat to look at the TV, displaying Star Wars: Return of the Jedi.

“Maybe KAREN had a major malfunction? Because she did sound weird when she was talking to me, like her speech wasn’t very smooth.”

“I’ll look into it. Just next time, don’t drop your phone. A million worries you gave me.” Peter laughed as Tony imitated the speech patterns of Yoda.

“Trust me, it wasn’t my idea to drop the phone.” He giggled, looking back at the screen.

reblog.comment:

Broken Phones and A Million Worries

◸

Author: @theironangel | ♚

Masterlist | ♛

Posted On/At: 7/18/2018 at 8:05 Central US Time Zone | ♜

Word Count: 1550 | ♝

Warnings: Other than that I’m a beginner writer so this may not be very in character, nothing really. Please enjoy. | ♞

“Sure thing boss.” the AI responded. A holographic screen came up, showing the pair a map pinpointing where the Spider-Man suit was.

“Are you sure we should go get him? He’s probably busy fighting crime,” Happy raised an eyebrow, not looking up from his phone.

“First of all, I need help on this mission, and I haven’t seen Peter in forever. Secondly, if he was just busy fighting crime, he would have at least had KAREN send us a “Sorry can’t talk right now.” message. Third, doesn’t he live in Queens? Why would he be so far on a school night? His tracker says he’s in Staten Island,” Tony enlarged the map so Happy could see it better.

“You saw the kid last week,” Happy pointed out, “Anyway, Staten Island isn’t too far from Queens, Tony. Don’t jump to conclusions. Why don’t you get Rhodey to come on the mission with you?” Happy glanced up at Tony and the screen, switching his phone for the tablet on the table in front of him.

“A) Rhodey’s already coming, B) this was supposed to be Peter’s first mission as part of a team, and C) The last time Peter was in Staten Island with the suit, he got the ferry split in two.” Tony listed, counting the reasons with his fingers.

Happy rolled his eyes, looking back to his tablet. “At least try calling his suit directly through KAREN, before going find him.”

Tony nodded to Happy before walking to his lab, opening the door, and sitting down at his desk.

“Friday, can you call KAREN?”

“You want me to call KAREN?” FRIDAY asked.

“Yes, call KAREN. And don’t let Peter decline the call,” he added, pulling up the screen with the map showing the suit’s location, which hadn’t moved from Staten Island.

“Mr. Stark is that you?” Peter’s voice was raspy and Tony could hear the cough through the microphone in the suit.

“Yeah Peter it’s me. What are you doing? Happy and I’ve been texting and calling you, but you never responded. I’m a bit worried,”

“I’m uh, cold. Very cold. Like I can barely move cold. Uh I found-”

“Do you have the heater on?” Tony interrupted to ask.

“I think the heater is broken. KAREN says she can’t turn it on,” Peter coughed again.

“Are you okay? Do I need to come pick you up?”

“Actually that sounds good.” Peter said, “Why were you and Happy calling?”

“I was gonna take you on a mission with Rhodey, but you don’t really sound up for it,”

“Mr. Stark I am too up for it! I can-” Peter broke off in a fit of coughing and Tony’s eyebrows creased together in concern.

“You okay, Pete? Just stay where you are I’m on my way.”

“Don’t hang up on me please,”

“Course not bud. FRIDAY, reroute call to my phone.” Tony picked up his phone as FRIDAY switched the call from the home speaker to his phone.

“So what were you doing that made you so cold?” Tony asked, already walking to the garage.

“Uh well these two guys were trying to rob this girl, but obviously I stopped them. And the girl was thankful, and she let me walk her home, and so when we got to her apartment place she walked inside and was like thank you so much! So anyway I started walking home because it’s getting late and I’m tired. But as I was swinging home, someone or something cut the web that I was swinging on, and so I took an unplanned swim in the river, and apparently my heater’s broken, and I’m really cold and soaking wet,” Peter rambled, only cutting himself off a few times to cough loudly before continuing his story.

“Ok. How do you know the web was cut and it didn’t break?” When Peter finished his story, Tony was already in the car driving towards Peter.

“Well when I saw the broken end, it was way too even to have been a break. Like the web would’ve stretched if it broke, but this was a really clean cut, nothing stretched or anything. Also, for the web to break there would’ve had to have been a lot of pressure of the web, like way heavier than just me,” Peter thought back to how the only times he remembered his webs ever breaking was when he tried to catch the elevator and when he was trying to stop the ferry from sinking.

“Yeah, you did a great job making those things.” Tony complemented.

“Thanks! Hey Mr. Stark where are you anyway?”

“I’m very close to where you are now, just hang tight.” Tony rounded a corner in the car.

-

Tony pulled his car over near the bench Peter was sitting on and rolled down the window.

“Come on Spider-Man, get in the car.”

“Hey, Mr. Stark, thanks for coming!”

“No problem kid.” Tony reached over and turned up the heater as Peter climbed into the car.

“I found a really cute lost golden retriever puppy and helped him get back to his owner.”

“Cool, hey why didn’t you call or text Happy and I back?” Tony asked, turning the car around to get back to the compound.

“Uh…”

“Do you know where it is or can I buy you a new one?”

“Mr. Stark you don’t need to buy me a new phone. Probably.” Peter shivered in the car despite the heater being on full blast, and coughed again.

“So why weren’t you answering-”

“Mr. Stark, look out!” Peter yelled, spider senses going crazy as his eyes widened when they saw the large black van coming too fast at their car.

-

The lights were blinding when Peter could finally open his eyes to see where he was.

“Where?” He rasped out, voice still sore from the cold he probably had.

“You’re fine. You’re at the Avengers compound.” A voice that Peter didn’t recognize informed him.

“Mr. Stark?”

“No kid, it’s Rhodey. Tony’s in another room. Quite the accident y’all got into.” Rhodey was sitting near Peter’s feet at the end of the bed.

“Wasn’t our fault,” Peter responded sleepily, “Mr. Stark okay? May know?”

“Your Aunt May is on her way. Tony’s in another room.” Rhodey informed him.

“You already said that. Is Mr. Stark okay?” Peter sat up and looked Rhodey in the eye, ignoring the pain flaring through his left arm. “Is he?”

“Peter, please don’t hurt yourself anymore than you already are,”

“Tell me if Mr. Stark is okay or not!” Peter rarely yelled at people, but he was very worried about his mentor because he still hadn’t seen him yet.

“He’s fine Peter, nothing to worry about.”

“Is he awake?”

“Not yet,”

“Why not?”

“Peter, you just got into a pretty bad car accident. It was only three hours ago. Give him time.” Rhodey stood up from his position at the feet of Peter’s bed.

“Do you need anything to eat? Drink?” Rhodey asked.

“Water please.” Peter sighed and laid back into the pillows on his bed, grateful that his throat wasn’t sore and his cough seemed to have gone away.

-

“Mr. Stark!” Peter yelled, popping up from the couch he was sitting on to look at his mentor leaning against the doorway to the living room.

“So why weren’t you answering your phone?” Tony continued the conversation as if nothing had happened, as if three days hadn’t passed since the car accident.

“My phone kinda exploded?” Peter adjusted the sling on his arm, careful not to hurt himself.

“It, the, what?”

“Well there was a fire, and I helped get the people out and I went back in to make sure everyone was out safely but the building started groaning, and I swung out really quickly but I dropped my phone, and I couldn’t go back because the building pretty much exploded.” Peter explained leaning back into the couch.

“So you weren’t getting the messages or call through KAREN until I called her directly?” Tony pushed off the doorway he was leaning on and sat on a chair across from the couch.

“Nope.” He replied popping the P. “I had no idea you guys were calling or texting me, and KAREN didn’t tell me about it.”

“I wonder if that has anything to do with the broken heater?” Tony shifted in his seat to look at the TV, displaying Star Wars: Return of the Jedi.

“Maybe KAREN had a major malfunction? Because she did sound weird when she was talking to me, like her speech wasn’t very smooth.”

“I’ll look into it. Just next time, don’t drop your phone. A million worries you gave me.” Peter laughed as Tony imitated the speech patterns of Yoda.

“Trust me, it wasn’t my idea to drop the phone.” He giggled, looking back at the screen.
trail.content:
Broken Phones and A Million Worries

◸

Author: @theironangel | ♚

Masterlist | ♛

Posted On/At: 7/18/2018 at 8:05 Central US Time Zone | ♜

Word Count: 1550 | ♝

Warnings: Other than that I’m a beginner writer so this may not be very in character, nothing really. Please enjoy. | ♞

◺

-

“Pete?” Tony sent the message to Peter’s phone after Peter had missed four phone calls from Tony, and another two from Happy.

“Kid, answer your phone.” Tony tried again, after a few minutes of no reply.

“Peter where are you?” Happy’s fingers tapped quickly at the screen when he tried texting Peter as well.

“He’s not answering me,” Happy said after a few minutes.

“Me neither. FRIDAY, pull up the location of Peter’s suit.” Tony answered Happy, then addressed the AI in the compound.

“Sure thing boss.” the AI responded. A holographic screen came up, showing the pair a map pinpointing where the Spider-Man suit was.

“Are you sure we should go get him? He’s probably busy fighting crime,” Happy raised an eyebrow, not looking up from his phone.

“First of all, I need help on this mission, and I haven’t seen Peter in forever. Secondly, if he was just busy fighting crime, he would have at least had KAREN send us a “Sorry can’t talk right now.” message. Third, doesn’t he live in Queens? Why would he be so far on a school night? His tracker says he’s in Staten Island,” Tony enlarged the map so Happy could see it better.

“You saw the kid last week,” Happy pointed out, “Anyway, Staten Island isn’t too far from Queens, Tony. Don’t jump to conclusions. Why don’t you get Rhodey to come on the mission with you?” Happy glanced up at Tony and the screen, switching his phone for the tablet on the table in front of him.

“A) Rhodey’s already coming, B) this was supposed to be Peter’s first mission as part of a team, and C) The last time Peter was in Staten Island with the suit, he got the ferry split in two.” Tony listed, counting the reasons with his fingers.

Happy rolled his eyes, looking back to his tablet. “At least try calling his suit directly through KAREN, before going find him.”

Tony nodded to Happy before walking to his lab, opening the door, and sitting down at his desk.

“Friday, can you call KAREN?”

“You want me to call KAREN?” FRIDAY asked.

“Yes, call KAREN. And don’t let Peter decline the call,” he added, pulling up the screen with the map showing the suit’s location, which hadn’t moved from Staten Island.

“Mr. Stark is that you?” Peter’s voice was raspy and Tony could hear the cough through the microphone in the suit.

“Yeah Peter it’s me. What are you doing? Happy and I’ve been texting and calling you, but you never responded. I’m a bit worried,”

“I’m uh, cold. Very cold. Like I can barely move cold. Uh I found-”

“Do you have the heater on?” Tony interrupted to ask.

“I think the heater is broken. KAREN says she can’t turn it on,” Peter coughed again.

“Are you okay? Do I need to come pick you up?”

“Actually that sounds good.” Peter said, “Why were you and Happy calling?”

“I was gonna take you on a mission with Rhodey, but you don’t really sound up for it,”

“Mr. Stark I am too up for it! I can-” Peter broke off in a fit of coughing and Tony’s eyebrows creased together in concern.

“You okay, Pete? Just stay where you are I’m on my way.”

“Don’t hang up on me please,”

“Course not bud. FRIDAY, reroute call to my phone.” Tony picked up his phone as FRIDAY switched the call from the home speaker to his phone.

“So what were you doing that made you so cold?” Tony asked, already walking to the garage.

“Uh well these two guys were trying to rob this girl, but obviously I stopped them. And the girl was thankful, and she let me walk her home, and so when we got to her apartment place she walked inside and was like thank you so much! So anyway I started walking home because it’s getting late and I’m tired. But as I was swinging home, someone or something cut the web that I was swinging on, and so I took an unplanned swim in the river, and apparently my heater’s broken, and I’m really cold and soaking wet,” Peter rambled, only cutting himself off a few times to cough loudly before continuing his story.

“Ok. How do you know the web was cut and it didn’t break?” When Peter finished his story, Tony was already in the car driving towards Peter.

“Well when I saw the broken end, it was way too even to have been a break. Like the web would’ve stretched if it broke, but this was a really clean cut, nothing stretched or anything. Also, for the web to break there would’ve had to have been a lot of pressure of the web, like way heavier than just me,” Peter thought back to how the only times he remembered his webs ever breaking was when he tried to catch the elevator and when he was trying to stop the ferry from sinking.

“Yeah, you did a great job making those things.” Tony complemented.

“Thanks! Hey Mr. Stark where are you anyway?”

“I’m very close to where you are now, just hang tight.” Tony rounded a corner in the car.

-

Tony pulled his car over near the bench Peter was sitting on and rolled down the window.

“Come on Spider-Man, get in the car.”

“Hey, Mr. Stark, thanks for coming!”

“No problem kid.” Tony reached over and turned up the heater as Peter climbed into the car.

“I found a really cute lost golden retriever puppy and helped him get back to his owner.”

“Cool, hey why didn’t you call or text Happy and I back?” Tony asked, turning the car around to get back to the compound.

“Uh…”

“Do you know where it is or can I buy you a new one?”

“Mr. Stark you don’t need to buy me a new phone. Probably.” Peter shivered in the car despite the heater being on full blast, and coughed again.

“So why weren’t you answering-”

“Mr. Stark, look out!” Peter yelled, spider senses going crazy as his eyes widened when they saw the large black van coming too fast at their car.

-

The lights were blinding when Peter could finally open his eyes to see where he was.

“Where?” He rasped out, voice still sore from the cold he probably had.

“You’re fine. You’re at the Avengers compound.” A voice that Peter didn’t recognize informed him.

“Mr. Stark?”

“No kid, it’s Rhodey. Tony’s in another room. Quite the accident y’all got into.” Rhodey was sitting near Peter’s feet at the end of the bed.

“Wasn’t our fault,” Peter responded sleepily, “Mr. Stark okay? May know?”

“Your Aunt May is on her way. Tony’s in another room.” Rhodey informed him.

“You already said that. Is Mr. Stark okay?” Peter sat up and looked Rhodey in the eye, ignoring the pain flaring through his left arm. “Is he?”

“Peter, please don’t hurt yourself anymore than you already are,”

“Tell me if Mr. Stark is okay or not!” Peter rarely yelled at people, but he was very worried about his mentor because he still hadn’t seen him yet.

“He’s fine Peter, nothing to worry about.”

“Is he awake?”

“Not yet,”

“Why not?”

“Peter, you just got into a pretty bad car accident. It was only three hours ago. Give him time.” Rhodey stood up from his position at the feet of Peter’s bed.

“Do you need anything to eat? Drink?” Rhodey asked.

“Water please.” Peter sighed and laid back into the pillows on his bed, grateful that his throat wasn’t sore and his cough seemed to have gone away.

-

“Mr. Stark!” Peter yelled, popping up from the couch he was sitting on to look at his mentor leaning against the doorway to the living room.

“So why weren’t you answering your phone?” Tony continued the conversation as if nothing had happened, as if three days hadn’t passed since the car accident.

“My phone kinda exploded?” Peter adjusted the sling on his arm, careful not to hurt himself.

“It, the, what?”

“Well there was a fire, and I helped get the people out and I went back in to make sure everyone was out safely but the building started groaning, and I swung out really quickly but I dropped my phone, and I couldn’t go back because the building pretty much exploded.” Peter explained leaning back into the couch.

“So you weren’t getting the messages or call through KAREN until I called her directly?” Tony pushed off the doorway he was leaning on and sat on a chair across from the couch.

“Nope.” He replied popping the P. “I had no idea you guys were calling or texting me, and KAREN didn’t tell me about it.”

“I wonder if that has anything to do with the broken heater?” Tony shifted in his seat to look at the TV, displaying Star Wars: Return of the Jedi.

“Maybe KAREN had a major malfunction? Because she did sound weird when she was talking to me, like her speech wasn’t very smooth.”

“I’ll look into it. Just next time, don’t drop your phone. A million worries you gave me.” Peter laughed as Tony imitated the speech patterns of Yoda.

“Trust me, it wasn’t my idea to drop the phone.” He giggled, looking back at the screen.
